page.title: 07REDFORD BARRACKS
page.content: Redford Barracks, in Colinton Road, was built at the end of the nineteenth century. The barracks were supposed to be built in India, but due to lack of space in Calcutta, were located in Edinburgh. The grounds are closely guarded, increasingly so with terrorist threats against the army in recent years. The Cavalry section houses the horses which are used on parade and the Infantry section provides accommodation for the soldiers. Within the barracks there is an education centre, a Chapel, tennis and squash courts, gym, shop, bar, canteen, medical centre and space for 750 trucks. Soldiers perform regularily in their own pipe and military bands, and are a popular item at the annual Edinburgh International Festival.
